arts.sum: Join our Derby County WhatsApp group to get the latest Rams headlines sent straight to your phone. Asked for his assessment after the game, Derby head coach Warne said: "I am disappointed really because I thought my lads performed well enough to take at least a point," he said.

arts.ttl: Derby County player ratings v Sheffield Wednesday as scores range from 3 to 6 in Owls defeat - Leigh Curtis
arts.sum: But the best chance came before half-time when Kenzo Goudmijn whipped a cross to the back post for Jerry Yates who somehow hit the post from three yards. Derby struggled to find their rhythm and range early on and it just took nine minutes for them to be punished as Djeidi Gassama beat Sonny Bradley for pace before prodding into the path of Shea Charles.

arts.ttl: Josh Windass wonder goal helps Sheffield Wednesday claim spoils against Derby
arts.sum: Windass scored from inside his own half in the 4-2 win.

arts.ttl: Josh Windass scores wondergoal 'better than David Beckham's' as Sky Sports studio stunned
arts.sum: Josh Windass is certainly a man in form for Sheffield Wednesday and his stunning displays continued against Derby County with a brilliant goal from deep inside his own half at Hillsborough

arts.ttl: Five players set to miss Derby County's trip to Sheffield Wednesday
arts.sum: He was not involved for the defeat to Leeds on Sunday either and Warne said he was "unfortunately" going to miss the trip to Hillsborough tomorrow. However, the Rams have received an unexpected boost after Warne said he could return at the end of January.

arts.ttl: Paul Warne makes Derby County transfer feelings clear amid triple link
arts.sum: Paul Warne says Derby County's recent performances have not altered his thinking for the January transfer window. But asked whether that has changed his thinking as to what he craves in January, Derby's head coach Warne said: "No, not really.
